description.narrative: The Samoa Education Sector Support Program (ESSP) investment 2015-2018 is a partnership with the Governments of Samoa and New Zealand to assist the Government of Samoa to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of its education system so that (a) school aged children are better prepared to commence formal school; (b) primary school children can read, write and count and transition through the school system to higher education or vocational education and training and eventually to the world of work. ESSP supports: direct funding arrangements with Samoa Qualification Authority for TVET/PSET work and Ministry of Education Sports and Culture for bilateral support to the regional Pacific Benchmarking for Education Results (PaBER) and toward strengthening Sector coordination activities; and technical assistance to support the development work for Australia's current and future support. i.e. including for scoping, design and ongoing monitoring and quality assurance of the Program.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
